page.title: 06PLACE NAMES AROUND GLADESTRY
page.content: In English, the name of our village is Gladestry. No one is sure of the meaning of the name. In Welsh the name of the village is 'Llanfair Llwyth Yfnwg'. But only one or two people speak Welsh in our village now. On the map of our area there are thirty eight names. There are twenty Welsh names and eighteen names are English. A Welsh name usually means that the place is older than if it has an English name. An example is 'Gwern-dyfn-nant', which means 'The Alder marsh by the deep brook'. Some of the hills have Welsh names and some have English names. 'Cefnhir' is a Welsh name. It means 'Long Ridge'. Burl and Yew Tree Bank are examples of English names. A lot of the Welsh names are mixed-up because people do not understand them.
